New Records: Zebby Matthews allowed nine runs in a two-inning start, which is one of six times in team history a Twins pitcher has allowed nine or more earned runs in two or fewer innings
Key Match Events: Toronto put up seven runs in the first inning, with two-run homers by Daulton Varsho and Spencer Horwitz, and a two-run double by Leo Jim√©nez
Matthews allowed another two-run blast -- this one to Addison Barger -- in his second inning, which ended his night
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Rocco Baldelli emphasized the importance of learning from the experience for young starter Zebby Matthews
The Twins are in a position to roll with the growing pains of their young duo of Top 100 prospects-turned-rotation-mainstays in Matthews and David Festa
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Rocco Baldelli said the team will move on from the loss and focus on the next game
Zebby Matthews said he has a lot to learn and will respond to the roadblock with better performance next time
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins allowed 23 hits, their most in a game since 2011
The game was a 15-0 thumping by the Blue Jays, which matched the second-largest margin of defeat in club history in a shutout loss
Others: Kyle Farmer set the Twins record for most innings pitched in a game by a position player with two
The Twins care to take away from this game is that their young starter learns from the experience
